content:
Diagnosis:		Silent corticotroph pituitary adenoma

Management:		Transsphenoidal surgery March 2023

Histology:		SF1 negative silent corticotroph adenoma

Current Situation:	Post-operative surveillance

[redacted name] attended endocrine oncology clinic today for routine follow-up. The 3-month post-operative MRI pituitary from June 2023 showed complete resection with no residual tumor. Endocrine function remains stable with morning cortisol 350 nmol/L and normal thyroid function. Visual fields testing shows continued improvement in the right temporal field deficit. No new symptoms reported. The patient has returned to work full-time and is managing well.

Plan is to continue current hormone replacement and arrange repeat MRI pituitary in 6 months' time with endocrine clinic follow-up.

cancer_timeline.value: 3-month post-operative MRI pituitary shows complete resection with no residual tumor
Morning cortisol 350 nmol/L and normal thyroid function

patient_facts.value: Improving right temporal visual field deficit

status_updates.value: Silent corticotroph pituitary adenoma status post complete surgical resection. Stable on hormone replacement with improving visual fields.
Complete tumor resection on post-operative imaging with improving visual field deficit
